hanzi-su-wiki:
種

Значения

Семя, косточка; сорт, вид; материал, предмет, тема; причина, повод

Мнемоника

Просеивать семена злаковых 禾, разделяя их по фракциям с одинаковым весом 重 зёрен в каждой из них.

Варианты

种

heisig_chinese_memo: After the whole low-carb craze, scientists developed a new low-carb species of wheat, so that dieters could eat it without getting heavier.
heisig_constituent: species, wheat, cereal, heavy, thousand, ri, computer
koohiiStory1: Our species has a wheat heavy diet...
koohiiStory2: This kanji also means "Seed." STORY: Scientists have developed a new SPECIES of WHEAT that has large HEAVY seeds. Now we can feed the world.
jp_example_words:
各種(かくしゅ): every kind, all sorts
種々(くさぐさ): variety
種(しゅ): kind, variety, species
品種(ひんしゅ): brand, kind, description
一種(いっしゅ): species, kind, variety
種類(しゅるい): variety, kind, type, category, counter for different sorts of things
人種(じんしゅ): race (of people)
種(たね): seed, kind, variety, quality, tone, material, matter, subject, theme, (news) copy, cause, source, trick, secret, inside story
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If a grain seems extra heavy, you know it's a different kind. Not all types of grains are the same. So when you feel the heavy type, you know it isn't the same as the light kind.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine sorting all the different types of grains by their weight.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You sort all of the different kinds and types by putting them in the right chutes (しゅ). They slide away, probably to some big type-based piles you can't see.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the two chutes you use to separate the different types of grains. One has a sign that says "Light Chute" and the other says "Heavy Chute."

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Planting this new species of weed in the middle of your current wheat will help all your crops grow faster.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " Wo ", " heavy " sound, the original meaning of seed plants. "Book of Yi Zhou‧ Da Kuang": "No vegetables, no food."

" Species " can mean race. "Historical Records: The Family of Chen She": "If a strong man is immortal, he will be a famous man when he dies. Princes and generals would rather have a kind!"

" Species " can also indicate species. "Han Feizi·Foreign Reserve Says Upper Left": "People in Zheng County have a yoke, but don't know their name, they ask: "What kind of thing is this?"

" Species " can be extended to quantifiers, indicating categories. "Han Shu‧ Art and Literature History": "There are nine preface six arts."

" Species " can also mean that grasses grow early and mature late, and are also written as "穜". "Shuowen": "The first and the second. From the He, the heavy sound." "Zhou Li·Tianguan·Nei Zai": "Shangchun, the emperor's queen commanded the man of the sixth palace, and he gave birth to the seed of Longji, and Dedicated to the king."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " He ", " Heavy ", the original meaning is the seed of a plant.
humanum_full_description:
從「禾」，「重」聲，本義為植物的種子。《逸周書‧大匡》：「無播蔬，無食種。」

　　「種」可表示族類。《史記‧陳涉世家》：「且壯士不死即已，死即舉大名耳，王侯將相，寧有種乎！」

　　「種」也可表示種類。《韓非子‧外儲說左上》：「鄭縣人有得車軛者，而不知其名，問人曰：『此何種也？』」

　　「種」可引申為量詞，表示類別。《漢書‧藝文志》：「序六藝為九種。」

　　「種」還可表示禾類早種晚熟，亦寫作「穜」。《說文》：「先穜後孰也。从禾，重聲。」《周禮·天官·內宰》：「上春，詔王后帥六宮之人，而生穜稑之種，而獻之于王。」
humanum_short_description: 從「禾」，「重」聲，本義為植物的種子。

③具有共同起源和共同遺傳特徵的人羣：人種。種族。
④量詞，表示類別、式樣：種種。兩種人。
⑤指膽量或骨氣：有種。沒種。
⑥姓氏。

從「 禾 」，「 重 」聲，本義為植物的種子。《逸周書‧大匡》：「無播蔬，無食種。」 「 種 」可表示族類。《史記‧陳涉世家》：「且壯士不死即已，死即舉大名耳，王侯將相，寧有種乎！」 「 種 」也可表示種類。《韓非子‧外儲說左上》：「鄭縣人有得車軛者，而不知其名，問人曰：『此何種也？』」 「 種 」可引申為量詞，表示類別。《漢書‧藝文志》：「序六藝為九種。」 「 種 」還可表示禾類早種晚熟，亦寫作「 穜 」。《說文》：「先穜後孰也。从禾，重聲。」《周禮·天官·內宰》：「上春，詔王后帥六宮之人，而生穜稑之種，而獻之于王。」
From the " Wo", " heavy" sound, the original meaning of seed plants. "Book of Yi Zhou‧ Da Kuang": "No vegetables, no food." " Species" can mean race. "Historical Records: The Family of Chen She": "If a strong man is immortal, he will be a famous man when he dies. Princes and generals would rather have a kind!" " Species" can also indicate species. "Han Feizi·Foreign Reserve Says Upper Left": "People in Zheng County have a yoke, but don't know their name, they ask: "What kind of thing is this?" " Species" can be extended to quantifiers, indicating categories. "Han Shu‧ Art and Literature History": "There are nine preface six arts." " Species" can also mean that grasses grow early and mature late, and are also written as " 穜". "Shuowen": "The first and the second. From the He, the heavy sound." "Zhou Li·Tianguan·Nei Zai": "Shangchun, the emperor's queen commanded the man of the sixth palace, and he gave birth to the seed of Longji, and Dedicated to the king."

種字的基本解释

種
zhǒng

種
zhòng
均见“种”。

種字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhǒng］
［《廣韻》之隴切，上腫，章。］
亦作“穜2”。“种2”的繁体字。
(1)植物的种子。
(2)人或其他生物的族类。
(3)引申为后嗣。
(4)种类。
(5)引申为量词。表示类别。
(6)即物种。生物分类系统上所用的基本单位。
(7)头发短少貌。参见“種種”、“種髮”。
(8)指胆量或骨气。
(9)通“腫”。
(10)古地名。
[②]［zhòng］
［《廣韻》之用切，去用，章。］
亦作“穜3”。“种3”的繁体字。
(1)把植物或它的种子埋入土中使之生长。
(2)培养；培植。
(3)繁殖；养育。
(4)移植；接种。参见“種2齒”、“種2痘”。
(5)散布；传播。
(6)点燃。

種字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【禾字部】　種； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页856第16
〔古文〕??【廣韻】之隴切【集韻】【韻會】主勇切，?音腫。穀種也。【詩·大雅】誕降嘉種。【周禮·地官·草人】以物地相其宜，而爲之種。又【夏官·職方氏】豫州，其穀宜五種。【註】黍稷菽麥稻。　又種類。【書·盤庚】無俾易種于兹新邑。【史記·高帝紀】恐事不就後，秦種族其家。【後漢·竇融傳】此遺種處也。　又地名。【史記·貨殖傳】楊平陽?西賈秦翟，北賈種代。【註】種在恆州石邑縣，北蓋蔚州也。　又外域國名。【後漢·任延傳】武威郡，北當匈奴，南接種羌，民畏宼抄，多棄田業。　又【莊子·胠篋篇】舍夫種種之機。【註】種種，謹慤貌。　又【增韻】種種，猶物物也。　又髮短貌。【左傳·昭三年】余髮如此種種。　又【廣韻】之用切【集韻】朱用切，?音偅。蓺植也，布也。【書·大禹謨】臯陶邁種德。【註】種，布也。種物必布於地，故爲布也。【史記·李斯傳】所不去者，醫藥卜筮種樹之書。【前漢·律歷志】鶉首初井十六度，芒種。　【正字通】說文種，先穜後孰也。从禾，重聲，直容切。穜，蓺也，从禾童聲

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhǒng］
[Long cut in "Guang Yun", swollen upper part, chapter. ]
Also known as "穜2". The traditional characters of "种2".
(1) Seeds of plants.
(2) The race of people or other creatures.
(3) Extended to heirs.
(4) Type.
(5) Extended to quantifiers. Represents the category.
(6) The species. The basic unit used in a biological classification system.
(7) Short hair and appearance. See "various", "variety of hair".
(8) Refers to courage or spine.
(9) Through "swelling".
(10) Ancient place names.
[②]［zhòng］
[The use of "Guang Yun" cut, use, chapter. ]
Also known as "穜3". The traditional characters of "种3".
(1) Bury the plant or its seeds in the soil to make it grow.
(2) Cultivation; Cultivation.
(3) Breeding; nurturing.
(4) Transplantation; inoculation. See "species 2 teeth", "species 2 pox".
(5) Spread; spread.
(6) Ignite.

Name meaning
Nothing.
zhǒng, zhòng, chóng
вм. 种
Radicals: 禾, 重  (grain, heavy)
Meaning Mnemonic
If a grain seems extra heavy, you know it's a different kind. Not all types of grains are the same. So when you feel the heavy type, you know it isn't the same as the light kind.
Imagine sorting all the different types of grains by their weight.
Reading Mnemonic
You sort all of the different kinds and types by putting them in the right chutes (しゅ). They slide away, probably to some big type-based piles you can't see.
Picture the two chutes you use to separate the different types of grains. One has a sign that says "Light Chute" and the other says "Heavy Chute."
